intro: Saxifraga stribrnyi, commonly known as the striped saxifrage, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves that are typically green with distinct white or pale markings. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually pink or white, appearing in clusters during the summer months. Saxifraga stribrnyi is well adapted to harsh climates and is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and hardiness.
